```{r setup, include=FALSE}
knitr::opts_chunk$set(echo = TRUE)
library(tidyverse)
library(learnrhash)
```

```{r}
hashes <- here::here("fa20/quizzes/quiz5exp.csv") %>% 
  read_csv(col_types = cols(.default = col_character())) %>% 
  janitor::clean_names() %>% 
  select(-c(state, started_on, completed, starts_with('grade'))) %>% 
  rename(hash = response_1) %>% 
  filter(hash != '-') %>% 
  filter(!str_detect(email_address, "jrw53")) # he didn't actually copy the hash
hashes
```

```{r}
res <- hashes$hash[2] %>% learnrhash::decode_obj()
```

They don't want question state to include correct flag:
https://github.com/rstudio/learnr/pull/393

```{r}

hashes %>% learnrhash::extract_questions(hash) %>% unnest(answer)
```
